Returns: a string representation of this object
toString().Description: Return a string representation of this ParsePosition.

ParsePosition(int).Description: Create a new ParsePosition with the given initial index.

Parameters: int: the index at which an error occurred
setErrorIndex(int).Description: Set the index at which a parse error occurred. Formatters should set this before returning an error code from their parseObject method. The default value is -1 if this is not set.

Returns: true if this object is the same as the obj argument; false otherwise.
Parameters: Object: the reference object with which to compare.

Returns: the index at which an error occurred
getErrorIndex().Description: Retrieve the index at which an error occurred, or -1 if the error index has not been set.

getIndex().Description: Retrieve the current parse position. On input to a parse method, this is the index of the character at which parsing will begin; on output, it is the index of the character following the last character parsed.

Returns: a hash code value for this object
hashCode().Description: Returns a hash code for this ParsePosition.

ClassDesc: ParsePosition is a simple class used by Format and its subclasses to keep track of the current position during parsing. The parseObject method in the various Format classes requires a ParsePosition object as an argument. By design, as you parse through a string with different formats, you can use the same ParsePosition, since the index parameter records the current position.
